documentation.openai: The OpenAI dependency is used for various AI-related tasks, such as generating text and embeddings. It is integrated into the application to provide AI capabilities.
documentation.anthropic: The Anthropic dependency is used as an alternative to OpenAI for AI-related tasks. It provides similar functionalities and is integrated to offer flexibility in choosing AI providers.
documentation.express: Express is a web application framework for Node.js. It is used to set up the server and define API routes.
documentation.socket.io: Socket.io is used for real-time communication between the server and clients. It is integrated to handle real-time events and data updates.
documentation.dotenv: Dotenv is used to load environment variables from a .env file. It is integrated to manage configuration settings.
documentation.lodash: Lodash is a utility library that provides various functions for common programming tasks. It is integrated to simplify data manipulation.
documentation.firebase-admin: Firebase Admin SDK is used to interact with Firebase services. It is integrated for database and authentication functionalities.
documentation.yaml: YAML is a data serialization format. The yaml and yaml-js dependencies are used to parse and generate YAML files.
documentation.sharp: Sharp is an image processing library. It is integrated to handle image manipulations.
documentation.cors: CORS is a middleware for Express to enable Cross-Origin Resource Sharing. It is integrated to allow requests from different origins.
documentation.open: Open is used to open URLs in the default browser. It is integrated to facilitate development and debugging.
documentation.vectra: Vectra is used for vector operations, such as querying vector databases. It is integrated to handle vector-related tasks.
